title: Schedule
content:
Schedule# Note:The schedule below is tentative and subject to change.
Important Links (Assignment Related)# Paper Presentations
Google Slides Template: LINK Due by 5pm the day before your presentation (Piazza post with slides and discussion topics). 'Implement Something' Assignment / Presentation
Details coming soon. Final Project

Introduction
Goal: Introduce the course goals, expectations, and format.
Slides:LINK TO SLIDES (coming soon) Class 2 â€” Thu, Jan 22, 2026
Fundamentals Primer & The Paper "Draft"
Goal: Quick review of common terms and formulations in robotics literature and in-class sign up for paper presentations.
Slides:LINK TO SLIDES (coming soon) Additional Resources: Springer Handbook of Robotics (TBD Chapters) Class 3 â€” Tue, Jan 27, 2026
Fundamentals 1: The Needs and Opportunities of Robots
Goal: We will start with a broad perspective about opportunities for robots and research progress over a longer horizon.
Collaborative Robots and Industrial Revolution 4.0 (IR 4.0) The Evolution of Robotics Research â€” From Industrial Robotics to Field and Service Robotics Class 4 â€” Thu, Jan 29, 2026
Fundamentals 2: Moving Your Robot & Robot Systems
Goal: Robot research often involves deploying full-stack systems and inverse kinematics techniques.
DexPilot:Vision-Based Teleoperation of Dexterous Robotic Handâ€“Arm Systems RelaxedIK:Real-time Synthesis of Accurate and Feasible Robot Arm Motion Class 5 â€” Tue, Feb 3, 2026
Fundamentals 3: Planning Motions
Goal: Review of common planning techniques and modern optimization-based approaches.
Motion Planning:The Essentials Motion Planning Around Obstacles with Convex Optimization Additional Resources: Collision-Affording Point Trees (recent high-performance path planning RSS paper) ðŸ¤– Module 2: Learning# Class 6 â€” Thu, Feb 5, 2026
Learning Primer
Goal: Review high-level robot learning architectures and approaches.
Slides:LINK TO SLIDES (coming soon) Additional Resources: ALVINN:An Autonomous Land Vehicle in a Neural Network (original BC paper) Class 7 â€” Tue, Feb 10, 2026
Topic:Learning 1:Foundations
Goal: Review classical learning techniques including movement primitives and behavior cloning.
Movement Primitives Behavioral Cloning from Observation Additional Resources: ALVINN:An Autonomous Land Vehicle in a Neural Network (original BC paper) Generative Adversarial Imitation Learning (another example of a historically popular learning technique) Class 8 â€” Thu, Feb 12, 2026
Topic:Learning 2:End-to-End & Meta-Learning
Goal: End-to-end learning and early meta-learning approaches for generalization.
End-to-End Learning Model-Agnostic Meta-Learning Class 9 â€” Tue, Feb 17, 2026
Topic:Learning 3:Intermediate Representations
Goal: Learning with inferred reward functions and hierarchical correction.
Maximum Entropy Inverse Reinforcement Learning Yell At Your Robot Class 10 â€” Thu, Feb 19, 2026
Topic:Literature Review Workshop
Goal: Strategies for finding and evaluating robotics research.
Slides:LINK TO SLIDES (coming soon) Class 11 â€” Tue, Feb 24, 2026
Topic:Learning 4:The Rise of Generative Learning
Goal: Inflection point papers in generative robotics.
Do As I Can, Not As I Say Diffusion Policy Class 12 â€” Thu, Feb 26, 2026
Topic:Learning 5:Practical Considerations
Goal: Small design choices that impact learning systems.
What Matters in Learning from Offline Data Continuity of Rotation Representations Additional Resources: Much Ado About Noising: Dispelling the Myths of Generative Robotic Control (recent work questioning the need for architectural components in robotics generative models) Class 13 â€” Tue, Mar 3, 2026
Learning 6: Frontiers
Goal: Recent VLAs including from industry and leveraging video models.
Ï€âˆ— 0.6: a VLA That Learns From Experience mimic-video: Video-Action Models for Generalizable Robot Control Beyond VLAs ðŸ§  Module 3: Interactive Systems# Class 14 â€” Thu, Mar 5, 2026
Topic:Interactive Systems Primer
Goal: Introduce challenges and approaches for robot systems that work with people.
Slides:LINK TO SLIDES (coming soon) Class 15 â€” Tue, Mar 10, 2026
Interactive Systems 1: Teleoperation & Simplifying Human Input
Goal: Investigate lower level of autonomy systems for people to drive robot behavior.
Open-TeleVision: Teleoperation with Immersive Active Visual Feedback Learning Latent Actions to Control Assistive Robots Class 16 â€” Thu, Mar 12, 2026
Implement Something: Mini Presentations
Goal: Lightning presentations of your mini implementation projects
Presentation slides: LINK COMING SOON. Class 17 â€” Tue, Mar 17, 2026
ASYNCHRONOUS: Large Behavior Models
Goal: TRI has been one company leading the push on developing and evaluating foundation models for robotics. We will watch and dicuss a seminar related to their work.
Watch this lecture by Russ Tedrake and comment on the piazza post Additional Resources: A Careful Examination of Large Behavior Models for Multitask Dexterous Manipulation (complementary paper later released by Toyota Research Institute) Class 18 â€” Thu, Mar 19, 2026

Goal: Watch this lecture by Rodney Brooks and comment on the piazza post Additional Resources: LINK Class 19 â€” Tue, Mar 24, 2026
